title: Slow commit cycle
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: 2021.11.3-alpha
Machine specs: 64 GB ram, AMD 3900x, Samsung 970 Evo Plus 1TB

OS & Version: Linux Debian

#### Expected behaviour
All blocks import fast

#### Actual behaviour
Some blocks import fast, some really slow (seconds or minutes)

I run erigon as a secondary node in my machine (along with geth).
Startup arguments: 
```
--prune=rtc --prune.h.before 12376729 --txpool.disable --nodiscover --datadir /erigon --maxpeers 1 --ethash.dagdir /erigon/erigon-ethash --port 30305 --private.api.addr=localhost:9090 --staticpeers=enode://xxx:127.0.0.1:3005"
```
Erigon log:
```
[INFO] [11-24|02:58:05.785] Tables                                   freelist="171.59 MiB" PlainState="54.58 GiB" AccountChangeSet="22.88 GiB" StorageChangeSet="42.47 GiB" BlockTransaction="345.06 GiB" TransactionLog="5.72 GiB"
[INFO] [11-24|02:58:13.136] Commit cycle                             in=7.350810103s

[INFO] [11-24|03:02:06.019] Commit cycle                             in=2.174105ms
```
Thank you. We know the reason and working on it. But no ETA yet. It's not harmful.

Any insights on what is the problem? Is it a wider problem or a specific case? I noticed that openethereum is skipping blocks as well (only 1 block though then catches up on the next) so I though it may actually be geths fault or a configuration with my system.
No, it’s Erigon’s internal problem (related to our db configuration parameters).
Hi ! I have exactly the same issue - Any tips to fix it ?

> Hi ! I have exactly the same issue - Any tips to fix it ?

Not yet. But we slowly working on it.
FYI: looks like we solved root problem. Will release it in 2-3 weeks.
This seems to be resolved now! Thanks
